alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 8:47PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, Wallace County in west central Kansas, Thomas County in northwestern Kansas, northwestern Logan and northwestern Greeley Counties in west central Kansas, southern Rawlins and eastern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas through 930 PM MDT/1030 PM CDT/... At 846 PM MDT/946 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near McDonald to 10 miles southwest of Brewster to 13 miles northwest of Weskan. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. Blowing dust and the strongest winds are occurring ahead of any rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Weskan around 905 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Winona. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 33 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm will produce strong winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
